We and 
@RocketLab
 are targeting 12am ET Thursday, May 25 (0400 UTC), for the second launch of our cyclone-studying TROPICS mission.

Tune in here and at https://go.nasa.gov/424tYpt at 11:40pm ET (0340 May 25 UTC) for live launch coverage from New Zealand: https://go.nasa.gov/42071E4

For the first time, two 
@NASA
 super pressure balloons are in flight at the same time!

The two balloons launched from New Zealand with a primary goal of testing & qualifying the super pressure balloon tech for flight, while also flying science missions. https://go.nasa.gov/3pzfNvk
May is a good month for skywatchers. Venus, Mars, and Jupiter cozy up to the Moon, and even Saturn makes a cameo. Where and when to look: https://go.nasa.gov/37ePy0B

Is your type tall (maybe even "supermassive"), dark, and mysterious? Celebrate #BlackHoleWeek with us! 

Learn about these cosmic objects, share science updates, visualizations, and sonifications. Follow 
@NASAUniverse
 and get pulled in: https://go.nasa.gov/3ncukw9
LIVE: Watch a total solar eclipse in Australia with us! We're sharing live telescope views and answering your #AskNASA questions on NASA Science Live.

A solar eclipse will be visible over parts of Western Australia and Southeast Asia today. No matter where you are, you can watch the Moon block the Sun with us.
 
 At 10:30pm ET (0330 UTC), watch #NASAScience Live and ask NASA experts your questions, plus get a preview of… Show more

To help defend Earth from potentially hazardous asteroids and comets, we developed the #PlanetaryDefense Strategy & Action Plan. We’re eager to work with 
@WHOSTP
 in implementing it. https://go.nasa.gov/3mI3MlZ

Note: There are no known asteroid impact threats for 100+ years.

Launch alert: A new space-based instrument will monitor air quality across North America, providing hourly measurements to improve forecasts & inform policymakers.

#TEMPO is set to lift off no earlier than 12:30am ET (0430 UTC), Friday, April 7. Watch: https://go.nasa.gov/3Gsbt6v

Uranus. (Go ahead, get it out of your system. We tried.)⁣

Only Voyager 2 in the 1980s & Keck (with adaptive optics) have imaged the planet's rings before, and they've never been this clear. 
@NASAWebb
 highlights atmospheric features & 11 of its 13 rings: https://go.nasa.gov/414SqXV
The Soyuz MS-23 crew ship with three Exp 69 crewmates aboard docked to the Prichal docking module at 5:22am ET today completing a 37-minute relocation maneuver. More... https://go.nasa.gov/3nPnhcF

Astronauts need spacesuits for different occasions: life and work inside a spacecraft, spacewalks, and one day, planetary walks. In this episode of the Curious Universe podcast, we explore spacesuit design and creation, from fittings to new features: https://go.nasa.gov/3zxE6LK
LIVE: An update on the science of #TEMPO, a space-based instrument that will revolutionize the way scientists observe air quality.

LIVE: Watch #TEMPO launch to orbit on a @SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket. Liftoff expected as early as 12:30am ET (0430 UTC).

The @NASAEarth & @CenterForAstro mission is set to revolutionize air quality observations.
